moduleGroup.name: Cortical Surface Labeling
moduleGroup.description: This workflow is designed to take a raw 3D volume - it will segment the brain into 56 ROIs, generate the cortical surfaces using two methods (namely BrainSuite09 and FreeSurfer), and will use the ShapeTools library (ImageToShapeAttribute), to project the labels onto the shape.

input.description: The filename of the input MRI file in Analyze format.
input.name: Input File

input.description: specify directory to use for temporary files
input.name: Temp File Directory

module.name: Surface Generator
module.description: Generates mesh surfaces using an isosurface algorithm.

citations.citation: Shattuck DW, Sandor-Leahy SR, Schaper KA, Rottenberg DA, and Leahy RM, (2001) "Magnetic Resonance Image Tissue Classification Using a Partial Volume Model", Neuroimage 13(5):856-876 PMID: 11304082

input.name: Image Volume
input.description: shade surface model with data from image volume

module.name: ScrubMask
module.description: Scrubmask filters binary masks to trim loosely connected voxels that may result from segmentation errors and produce bumps on tessellated surfaces.

citations.citation: Shattuck DW, Sandor-Leahy SR, Schaper KA, Rottenberg DA, and Leahy RM, (2001) "Magnetic Resonance Image Tissue Classification Using a Partial Volume Model", Neuroimage 13(5):856-876 PMID: 11304082

input.description: Specify input structure mask file path

module.name: Partial Volume Classifier
module.description:
Partial Volume Classifier: Each voxel is classified according to the tissue type (WM, GM, CSF, and partial volume mixture) by combining the partial volume tissue model with a Gibbs spatial prior to produce a classifier that enourages contiguous regions of similar tissue type
PartialVolumeClassifier_1.FractionFile-01.img 0 <--> (CSF) 1 <--> 2 (GM) <--> 3 (WM) 1.25 means 75% CSF and 25% GM 1.75 is 25% CSF and 75% GM PartialVolumeClassifier_1.OutputFile-01.img 0 (CSF), 1 (GM), 2 (WM), 3 (GM/CSF), 4 (GM/WM), 5 (CSF/Other), 8 (Background)

citations.citation: Shattuck DW, Sandor-Leahy SR, Schaper KA, Rottenberg DA, and Leahy RM, (2001) "Magnetic Resonance Image Tissue Classification Using a Partial Volume Model", Neuroimage 13(5):856-876 PMID: 11304082

input.name: Mask File
input.description: An 8-bit file delineating brain/non-brain voxels; if not specified, PVC will assume non-zero voxels are foreground

input.name: Lambda
input.description: neighborhood constant (default: 0.1) increase for smoother boundaries decrease if labels are smeared

output.name: Fraction File
output.description: floating point output file of tissue fractions 1 (CSF) <-> 2 (GM) <-> 3 (WM)

module.name: Hemisphere Split
module.description: Splits a surface object into two separate surfaces given an input label volume. Each vertex is labeled left or right based on the labels being odd (left) or even (right). The largest contour on the split surface is then found and used as the separation between left and right.

citations.citation: Shattuck DW, Sandor-Leahy SR, Schaper KA, Rottenberg DA, and Leahy RM, (2001) "Magnetic Resonance Image Tissue Classification Using a Partial Volume Model", Neuroimage 13(5):856-876 PMID: 11304082

output.name: Left Surface
output.description: output surface file path, left hemisphere

output.name: Right Surface
output.description: output surface file path, right hemisphere

input.name: Pial Surface
input.description: pial surface file -- must have same geometry as input surface

output.name: Left Pial Output
output.description: output pial surface file, left hemisphere

output.name: Right Pial Output
output.description: output pial surface file, right hemisphere

module.name: Dewisp
module.description:
dewisp -- removes wispy tendril structures form cortex model binary masks. It does so based on graph theoretic analysis of connected components, similar to TCA. Each branch of the structure graph is analyzed to determine pinch points that indicate a likely error in segmentation that attaches noise to the image. The pinch threshold determines how many voxels the cross-section can be before it is considered part of the image.
dewisp is part of the BrainSuite collection of tools. For more information, please see: http://www.loni.ucla.edu/~shattuck/brainsuite Authored by David W. Shattuck, Laboratory of Neuro Imaging Dept. of Neurology, David Geffen School of Medicine, UCLA.

citations.citation: Shattuck DW, Sandor-Leahy SR, Schaper KA, Rottenberg DA, and Leahy RM, (2001) "Magnetic Resonance Image Tissue Classification Using a Partial Volume Model", Neuroimage 13(5):856-876 PMID: 11304082

module.name: FLIRT (nii.gz)
module.description: FLIRT (FMRIB's Linear Image Registration Tool) is a fully automated robust and accurate tool for linear (affine) intra- and inter-modal brain image registration.

citations.citation:
S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-219, 2004
PMID: 15501092

input.name: Input
input.description: Specifies the input volume file path.

output.name: Output
output.description: Specifies the output volume file path.

input.name: Initial Matrix File
input.description: Specifies the Input 4x4 affine matrix - autodetects format ascii/medx. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

output.name: Output Matrix File
output.description: Outputs the matrix in 4x4 ascii format. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

input.name: Datatype
input.description: Forces the output to one of the following data types: char, short, int, float, double.

input.name: Cost
input.description: Specifies the intensity based cost function. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Search Cost
input.description: Specifies the type of search cost. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Angle Rep
input.description: Specifies the type of angle rep. Options are: {quaternion,euler} (default is euler)

input.name: Interpolation
input.description: Specifies the type of final interpolation. Options are: trilinear, nearestneighbour, sinc. (Default is trilinear)

input.name: Sinc Width
input.description: Specifies the full sinc width in voxels. (Default is 7)

input.name: Bins
input.description: Specifies the number of histogram bins. (Default is 256)

input.name: Transform Degrees of Freedom
input.description:
Specifies the number of degrees of freedom. (Default is 12)
Note: Choose from 6,7,9 or 12 Degrees of Freedom (DOF) for full 3D registrations. Also includes a 3DOF 2D-to-2D registration mode which is selected using the -2D option. Note that it does not perform any search in 2D mode, and cannot deal with 2D to 3D registrations. More flexible DOF options are provided by the specific schedule files provided in $FSLDIR/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Force Scaling
input.description: Forces rescaling even for low-res images.

input.name: Min Sampling
input.description: Sets minimum voxel dimension for sampling (in mm).

input.name: Apply XFM with Isotropic Resample
input.description: As applyxfm but forces isotropic resampling. Must specify <scale>.

input.name: Padding Size
input.description: Interpolates outside image by size (in voxels). (Requires -applyxfm option)

input.name: Search X
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for x-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Y
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for y-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Z
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for z-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: No Search
input.description: Sets all angular search ranges to 0 0. (Sets 0 0 for -searchrx, -searchry and -searchrz)

input.name: Coarse Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 60)

input.name: Fine Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 18)

input.name: Schedule
input.description:
Schedule file specifies what transformations/DOF are allowed and how the optimisation is performed. Must specify <schedule-file>. (Replaces default schedule)
Note: Several other schedule files could be used - including 3D translation only schedules, etc. These are all stored in ${FSLDIR}/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Reference Weight
input.description: Use weights for reference volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Input Weight
input.description: Use weights for input volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Specifies level of verboseness. (0 is least and default)

input.name: Pause
input.description: Enables pause at each stage of transformation.

input.name: Sinc Window
input.description: Specifies the type of sinc window. Options are: rectangular, hanning, blackman.

input.name: Version
input.description: Prints the version information and exit

SSMA - Skull Stripping Meta Algorithm

module.name: Bias Field Corrector
module.description: Bias Field Corrector: Computes local estimates of gain variation in the iimage using an adaptive partial volume tissue model. Uses the estimates to compute a tri-cubic B-spline. Corrects the extracted barin image using values of the spline

module.name: Reorient
module.description:
Rotates volumes by 90 or 180 degrees and / or mirrors them along the major axes. This allows gross prealignment of volumes so that automated registration has a reasonable chance of success.
This program can also be used as a null operation that converts an input volume into the default output format specified during the compilation of the AIR package.

citations.citation: Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Holmes, C.J., Cherry, S.R., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998a). Automated image registration: I. General methods and intrasubject, intramodality validation. J Comput Assist Tomogr V22, 139-152. PMID: 9448779

Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Watson, J.D., Sicotte, N.L., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998b). Automated image registration: II. Intersubject validation of linear and nonlinear models. J Comput Assist Tomogr 22, 153-165. PMID: 9448780

module.name: 3D B-spline Deformation
module.description:
Peforms multi-modality B-spline based registration between a pair of 3D images.
The BSplineDeformableTransform is designed to be used for solving deformable registration problems. This transform is equivalent to generation a deformation field where a deformation vector is assigned to every point in space. The deformation vectors are computed using BSpline interpolation from the deformation values of points located in a coarse grid, that is usually referred to as the BSpline grid.

output.name: Difference Output
output.description: Specifies the output difference image after registration.

output.name: Difference Before
output.description: Specifies the output difference image before registration.

output.name: Deformation Field
output.description: Specifies the output deformation field file.

module.name: Brain Parser
module.description:
Usage: [-p structure] [-r testing] [source file] [target file] [-m path to the models] [-n number of structures] [-t number of iterations] [-s smoothness]
-p 0: segmenting sub-cortical structures 1: sulci detection 2: segmenting structures using a contextual model -r 0: perform segmentation/detection 1: perform training [source file]: in testing, it points to the source file in training, it points directory in which the training volumes are saved [target file]: in testing, it points to the target file in training, it points directory in which the trained classifiers are saved -m : directory of trained models -n : number of structures (only effective in training) -t : number of iterations (default value 3, for '-r 1', it is the number of auto-context classifiers) -s : smoothness factor (defalut=0.5, typical 0.0~2.0)

input.name: Source File
input.description: In testing, it points to the source file in training, it points directory in which the training volumes are saved.

output.name: Target File
output.description: In testing, it points to the target file in training, it points directory in which the trained classifiers are saved.

module.description: Get the inverse of the deformation field, which helps reverse the forward warpping result back to the original 3D image coordinate.

module.name: Convert XFM (nii.gz)
module.description:
Usage: convert_xfm [options] <input-matrix-filename> e.g. convert_xfm -omat <outmat> -inverse <inmat> convert_xfm -omat <outmat_AtoC> -concat <mat_BtoC> <mat_AtoB>
convert_xfm -ref <refvol> -in <invol> -omedx <medxmat> <flirtmat>
Available options are: -ref <refvol> (no default) -in <inputvol> (no default) -omat <matrix-filename> (4x4 ascii format) -omedx <matrix-filename> (MEDx format) -xfmtype {a,m,u,g,s,t} (Specify MEDx xfm format) a,m = AlignLinearReslice (default) u = UserTransformation g = GenericReslice s = ShadowTransform t = IntoTalairachSpace -concat <second-matrix-filename> -fixscaleskew <second-matrix-filename> -middlevol <intermediary-volume-filename> -inverse (Reference image must be the one originally used) -matonly (Use no volumes or MEDx support - default) -help

citations.citation:

De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-219, 2004

module.name: FLIRT (nii.gz)
module.description: FLIRT (FMRIB's Linear Image Registration Tool) is a fully automated robust and accurate tool for linear (affine) intra- and inter-modal brain image registration.

citations.citation:
S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-219, 2004
PMID: 15501092

input.name: Input
input.description: Specifies the input volume file path.

output.name: Output
output.description: Specifies the output volume file path.

input.name: Initial Matrix File
input.description: Specifies the Input 4x4 affine matrix - autodetects format ascii/medx. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

output.name: Output Matrix File
output.description: Outputs the matrix in 4x4 ascii format. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

input.name: Datatype
input.description: Forces the output to one of the following data types: char, short, int, float, double.

input.name: Cost
input.description: Specifies the intensity based cost function. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Search Cost
input.description: Specifies the type of search cost. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Angle Rep
input.description: Specifies the type of angle rep. Options are: {quaternion,euler} (default is euler)

input.name: Interpolation
input.description: Specifies the type of final interpolation. Options are: trilinear, nearestneighbour, sinc. (Default is trilinear)

input.name: Sinc Width
input.description: Specifies the full sinc width in voxels. (Default is 7)

input.name: Bins
input.description: Specifies the number of histogram bins. (Default is 256)

input.name: Transform Degrees of Freedom
input.description:
Specifies the number of degrees of freedom. (Default is 12)
Note: Choose from 6,7,9 or 12 Degrees of Freedom (DOF) for full 3D registrations. Also includes a 3DOF 2D-to-2D registration mode which is selected using the -2D option. Note that it does not perform any search in 2D mode, and cannot deal with 2D to 3D registrations. More flexible DOF options are provided by the specific schedule files provided in $FSLDIR/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Force Scaling
input.description: Forces rescaling even for low-res images.

input.name: Min Sampling
input.description: Sets minimum voxel dimension for sampling (in mm).

input.name: Apply XFM with Isotropic Resample
input.description: As applyxfm but forces isotropic resampling. Must specify <scale>.

input.name: Padding Size
input.description: Interpolates outside image by size (in voxels). (Requires -applyxfm option)

input.name: Search X
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for x-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Y
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for y-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Z
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for z-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: No Search
input.description: Sets all angular search ranges to 0 0. (Sets 0 0 for -searchrx, -searchry and -searchrz)

input.name: Coarse Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 60)

input.name: Fine Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 18)

input.name: Schedule
input.description:
Schedule file specifies what transformations/DOF are allowed and how the optimisation is performed. Must specify <schedule-file>. (Replaces default schedule)
Note: Several other schedule files could be used - including 3D translation only schedules, etc. These are all stored in ${FSLDIR}/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Reference Weight
input.description: Use weights for reference volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Input Weight
input.description: Use weights for input volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Specifies level of verboseness. (0 is least and default)

input.name: Pause
input.description: Enables pause at each stage of transformation.

input.name: Sinc Window
input.description: Specifies the type of sinc window. Options are: rectangular, hanning, blackman.

input.name: Version
input.description: Prints the version information and exit

module.name: Reorient (8-bit)
module.description:
Rotates volumes by 90 or 180 degrees and / or mirrors them along the major axes. This allows gross prealignment of volumes so that automated registration has a reasonable chance of success.
This program can also be used as a null operation that converts an input volume into the default output format specified during the compilation of the AIR package.

citations.citation: Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Holmes, C.J., Cherry, S.R., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998a). Automated image registration: I. General methods and intrasubject, intramodality validation. J Comput Assist Tomogr V22, 139-152. PMID: 9448779

Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Watson, J.D., Sicotte, N.L., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998b). Automated image registration: II. Intersubject validation of linear and nonlinear models. J Comput Assist Tomogr 22, 153-165. PMID: 9448780

input.name: Input
input.description: The data file to be manipulated.

output.name: Output (Reoriented Volume)
output.description: The product of the specified manipulation in the default AIR Analyze Image format.

output.name: Output .air file
output.description: saves a .air file describing the transformation with input as the reslice file and output as the standard file

input.name: rotate +90 (interchange x and y)
input.description: Rotate +90 degrees to interchange x and y axes

input.name: rotate -90 (interchange y and x)
input.description: rotate -90 degrees to interchange y and x axes

input.name: rotate +90 (interchange x and z)
input.description: rotate +90 degrees to interchange x and z axes

input.name: rotate -90 (interchange z and x)
input.description: rotate -90 degrees to interchange z and x axes

input.name: rotate +90 (interchange y and z)
input.description: rotate +90 degrees to interchange y and z axes

input.name: rotate -90 (interchange z and y)
input.description: rotate -90 degrees to interchange z and y axes

module.name: OctahedralResample
module.description: This module resamples an arbitrary closed surface to have an octahedral triangulation. The input and output file formats may be any supported by the ShapeTools library.

input.name: input
input.description: This is the input shape. This must be closed and in a format supported by the ShapeTools library.

input.name: resolution
input.description: This specifies the image resolution used when resampling. Larger values allow the algorithm to capture more anatomic detail. A reasonable choice is the resolution of the image from which the original surface was constructred.

input.name: executable
input.description: The path to the python executable

input.name: fix topology
input.description: Fix the surface topology. This will ensure that the surface will be spherical, but some fine detail may be lost in the process

author.fullName: Boris Gutman, Ilya Eckstein, Ryan Cabeen

module.name: ReconAll
module.description: Performs all steps of the ReconAll process: 1. Motion Correction and Conform 2. NU (Non-Uniform intensity normalization) 3. Talairach transform computation 4. Intensity Normalization 1 5. Skull Strip 6. EM Register (linear volumetric registration) 7. CA Intensity Normalization 8. CA Non-linear Volumetric Registration 9. Remove neck 10. EM Register, with skull 11. CA Label (Aseg: Volumetric Labeling) and Statistics 12. Intensity Normalization 2 (start here for control points) 13. White matter segmentation 14. Edit WM With ASeg 15. Fill (start here for wm edits) 16. Tessellation (begins per-hemisphere operations) 17. Smooth1 18. Inflate1 19. QSphere 20. Automatic Topology Fixer 21. Final Surfs (start here for brain edits for pial surf) 22. Smooth2 23. Inflate2 24. Cortical Ribbon Mask 25. Spherical Mapping 26. Spherical Registration 27. Spherical Registration, Contralater hemisphere 28. Map average curvature to subject 29. Cortical Parcellation (Labeling) 30. Cortical Parcellation Statistics 31. Cortical Parcellation mapped to ASeg

input.name: Input Volume
input.description: Original MR file to be processed by FreeSurfer.

input.name: Subject ID
input.description: Name or identification of the subject whose MR is being processed. A directory will be made with this name in the specified Subject Directory.

input.name: Subject Directory
input.description: The absolute file path to the directory in which FreeSurfer should do its work. A directory with the Subject ID as its name will be created in this directory. There, FreeSurfer will establish its necessary directory structure.

input.name: Input Flow Control
input.description: Input to force order of execution

module.name: TranslateTo
module.description:
TranslateTo provides an automatic file format translation service for file formats read by the ShapeToolsIO library. TranslateTo uses the file format properties descriptions and the ShapePreparer classes contained in the ShapeToolsIO library file readers and writsr to map common geometry file compoenents to an output file format, if supported by the output format.
Where possible, per-vertex attributes are written to the output format; however, because each output format varies in the number and data type of allowed per-vertex attributes, lossless copying of vertex attributes cannot be guaranteed.
Each file format writer is reqauired to supply the means to prepare an arbitary input Shape for writing; This may include creating requried components (e.g. vertex normals). Thus, TranslateTo is essenially a wrapper for the various ShapePreparer classes provided by the ShapeToolsIO library file format writers. The sophistication and completeness of the preparation process varies with the output file format.

input.name: -check
input.description: checks to see if translation is possible.

input.name: -o
input.description: Enables replacing of output file, if it already exists..

input.name: inputType
input.description: Input file type used to check whether translation is possible.

input.name: -triangulate
input.description: Attempt to triangulate surface before translations

input.name: -orient
input.description: Attempt to triangulate and consistently orient surface before translations

input.name: -canPrepareValue
input.description: String printed checking indicates a translation is possible.

input.name: -cannotPrepareValue
input.description: String printed checking indicates a translation is not possible.

input.name: -version
input.description: Prints version number of this application.

input.name: -twiki
input.description: Writes command line arguments as a TWiki format table to output and exit.

module.name: TranslateTo
module.description:
TranslateTo provides an automatic file format translation service for file formats read by the ShapeToolsIO library. TranslateTo uses the file format properties descriptions and the ShapePreparer classes contained in the ShapeToolsIO library file readers and writsr to map common geometry file compoenents to an output file format, if supported by the output format.
Where possible, per-vertex attributes are written to the output format; however, because each output format varies in the number and data type of allowed per-vertex attributes, lossless copying of vertex attributes cannot be guaranteed.
Each file format writer is reqauired to supply the means to prepare an arbitary input Shape for writing; This may include creating requried components (e.g. vertex normals). Thus, TranslateTo is essenially a wrapper for the various ShapePreparer classes provided by the ShapeToolsIO library file format writers. The sophistication and completeness of the preparation process varies with the output file format.

input.name: -check
input.description: checks to see if translation is possible.

input.name: -o
input.description: Enables replacing of output file, if it already exists..

input.name: inputType
input.description: Input file type used to check whether translation is possible.

input.name: -triangulate
input.description: Attempt to triangulate surface before translations

input.name: -orient
input.description: Attempt to triangulate and consistently orient surface before translations

input.name: -canPrepareValue
input.description: String printed checking indicates a translation is possible.

input.name: -cannotPrepareValue
input.description: String printed checking indicates a translation is not possible.

input.name: -version
input.description: Prints version number of this application.

input.name: -twiki
input.description: Writes command line arguments as a TWiki format table to output and exit.
